APP_DESCRIPTION: An image converter that transforms image colors into specific palette colors like Wplace by applying options such as brightness, contrast, saturation, and dithering.
DOT_MODE_TOOLTIP:
When the original is a pixel art image,
it keeps pixel boundaries sharp when zooming.
TERRAIN_COLOR_TOOLTIP:
When drawing on a solid color terrain,
treats transparency as the selected background color.
NAME: Name

VALIDATION.COLOR_ALREADY_EXISTS: Color already exists in the current palette.
VALIDATION.NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS: Color name already exists in the current palette.
VALIDATION.PALETTE_ALREADY_EXISTS: This palette name is already in use.

ERROR.IMAGE_ONLY: Only image files can be uploaded.

ABOUT.DESCRIPTION: This is Wdot, an image palette color converter. Here is a guide on how to use the site.

TIP_1.TITLE: How to Convert Images
TIP_1.STEP_1: Upload the image you want to convert.
TIP_1.STEP_2: Select the colors from the palette.
TIP_1.STEP_3: Adjust brightness, contrast, saturation, dither, width, and height as desired.
TIP_1.STEP_4: Click the download button to save your image.

TIP_2.TITLE: How to Match Large Pixel Art
TIP_2.STEP_1: Upload the pixel art image you want to convert.
TIP_2.STEP_2: Switch to 'Original View' in the top left. A button to show the grid will appear. Click that button.
TIP_2.STEP_3: Turn on 'Pixel Mode' next to the upload button. Reduce the size until the grid aligns perfectly with the pixels.
TIP_2.STEP_4: Once it fits, switch back to 'Result View'. You will see the pixel art where one pixel occupies exactly one block.
